title: Understanding Calculated Fields
text: A calculated field is a special type of field in a table. It doesn't just store static data but instead uses a formula or function to compute its value.

title: Components of a Calculated Field
text: Calculated fields can include various components such as formulas, functions, and references to other cells or structured data.

hintAnswer: a $$\frac{field}{column}$$ in a table that contains a formula, function, cell references, structured references, or condition
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a calculated field?
choices: a $$\frac{field}{column}$$ in a table that contains a formula, function, cell references, structured references, or condition
a row in a table that contains a formula, function, cell references, structured references, or condition
a structured reference in a table
